titleStmt.title: Nathan Bibb et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4203

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Petitioners ^Nathan Bibb. General Douglas &^ state that at the June term 1863 of the Fayette Circuit Court the a bail bond executed by them as sureties of Emily who was indicted for larcey. They immediately after hearing that Emily had failed to attend had her arrested & delivered to the sheriff of Fayette Co who put her in jail. At the August term 1863, on the first day of court a judgment was entered against them without the knowledge of their counsel, who after it was entered ^& at same term^ moved to set aside the judg under the provisions of rec criminal code, said motion was overruled by the court as it was made too late. As they delivered the prisoner to the sheriff as soon as they learned she had forfeited her bond they pray your Excellency to remit said judgment.
The foregoing statements are substantially true, and as there seems to have been a Mistake if it can be properly done, I hope your Excellency will remit.

W. S Downey
Com atty
W C Goodloe
I recommend the remission of the judge of Aug Term 1863 of Comth of Ky against for $50 forfeited bail bond of Emily as they surrendered her to sheriff of Fayett Co

Fayette Cir Ct
vs
Nathan, Bibb & others
$50 --

Remit the forfeiture there being no judgt this whole case be remitted
T E Bramltte
12th Sept/ 63
